label: The Old Man of Cury
column5: An old man from Cury helps a stranded mermaid return to the sea and in return
column6: she grants him the powers to heal sickness
column8: and find thieves. He fulfills his promise and carries her back to the ocean
column9: later returning to a designated rock to receive his gifts
column10: along with a comb that ensures her presence whenever he needs it.

label: Mermaids and Their Curses
column5: A man in North Harris caught a mermaid who granted him three wishes for her release
column6: subsequently becoming a skilled herbal doctor with the ability to cure incurable diseases. In Carmarthenshire
column7: a tradition describes how harming a mermaid can bring a curse upon the perpetrator's family for nine generations.

label: The Mermaid and the Fishermen
column6: found entangled in fishing nets near Careg Ina close to New Quay
column7: was freed by fishermen and in gratitude
column8: warned them of a coming storm
column9: enabling them to safely reach land. Unfortunately

label: The Fishermen of Llandudoch and the Mermaid
column5: Fisherman Pergrin encountered a mermaid near Pen Cemmes and took her captive
column6: but released her when she promised to help him in times of need. Later
column7: the mermaid warned Pergrin of an impending storm
column8: allowing him to escape safely while other fishermen perished.

label: The Soul Cages
column6: a fisherman living on the coast of County Clare
column8: who invites him to an underwater feast and shows him soul-cages containing the souls of drowned sailors. Driven by empathy
column9: Jack sets about freeing the imprisoned souls while cleverly navigating both his friendship with Coomara and the curious meddling of his wife Biddy.
